moves.1. e4: E4 is a strong but common move.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. Nf3: A lot of the time your board will look like this
moves.4... Bb4: He mirrors him, trying to distract him
moves.6. dxc3 Nxe4 7. g4: He tries to capture one side of the board
moves.7... Qg5: Why on earth would you make that move!!!!!!???????
moves.8. Bxg5 Nxg5: The match has turned around completely
moves.9. Nxg5 Nd4: A clumsy attempt to capture the bishop
moves.10. cxd4 exd4 11. Qxd4: Now the board is owned by white
moves.11... c6: Black sees the danger his king is in
moves.12. Qxg7: Bang! But he would of had time for that later
moves.12... Rf8: ? Well I guess it was an ideal move
moves.13. Nxh7: White sees no danger in this move
moves.13... cxb5: A blind and stupid move which cost him the match
moves.14. Qxf8#: Checkmate. That is how a match can be turned around in a single, dumb move. Never underestimate anyone. I made that mistake against someone 200 rating points below me but he beat me quite easily. This wasn't a real match.
